column1: Small businesses are critical to the fabric of our community.  As we combat #COVIDー19 together I’m shopping small to support our local economy and fighting for the Senate GOP to pass the #HeroesAct so small biz owners receive the relief they deserve. #SmallBusinessSaturday

Throughout the year military families across the country and the globe make hard sacrifices.     Throughout the #COVID19 pandemic these sacrifices have been harder.     But know this: these sacrifices have not gone – nor will they not go – unnoticed.     #MilitaryFamilyMonth

👀 Join me on Thursday at 5:30 p.m. for my virtual health symposium #WinterIsComing on #COVID19 the potential vaccine and #MedicareForAll.   I’m happy to be joined by medical experts and my sister-in-service  @RepRobinKelly.  Register ⬇️: https://t.co/LpFU1FRB5M https://t.co/9dI68WOvAX

A potential COVID-19 vaccine is not a silver bullet to solve this pandemic overnight. We must not relax our public health protocols during this time. Let's continue to socially distance avoid large indoor gatherings and WEAR MASKS! We are in this together.   cc: @EnergyCommerce https://t.co/U6JPFpov5A

There are more safety risks that we must be aware of due to the COVID-19 pandemic. However that should not stop our civic duty of voting.   To find out have to receive your early voting or absentee voting ballet by mail click the link ⬇️: https://t.co/bSFx3snLzS

Millions have lost their jobs during the #COVID19 pandemic and with it their health insurance. The cost of a provider’s visit and out of pocket expenses for a prescription can put birth control pills out of reach. #FreeThePill

This #LaborDay it saddens me to celebrate J'Ouvert and the West Indian Day Carnival virtually but we must do all we can to stay safe. Let's social distance wear masks and celebrate our culture from home. Check out https://t.co/GsruMYBnoF to join the virtual celebration. https://t.co/yf5fafZzyM
Biggest attacks on USPS coming in the same swing states trending towards Biden because of 45's coronavirus failures...Must be a coincidence 🤔 https://t.co/c7iTkrsNyr

The disparate health impacts of COVID-19 exposed the prevalence of systemic racism.   Now systemic racism combined with Republican inaction and racist policy decisions will cause Black people to experience the worst economic impacts of the pandemic. https://t.co/RNeUqvwhLJ

It’s the 55th Anniversary of #Medicare & #Medicaid!  As our great nation combats #coronavirus I’m reminded of our need for affordable universal healthcare for ALL.   I will continue to stand as a proud #M4A advocate because affordable healthcare is a right not a privilege.

New York State's Rent Relief program ends TODAY.   If your rent burden has increased over the course of the pandemic take advantage of this program.   We must equalize the playing field for those who have been financially impacted by #COVID—19. 🙏🏾 https://t.co/jq5d6yq56m

Today my @EnergyCommerce colleagues and I are holding a hearing with pharmaceutical industry leaders to discuss the development of a safe and affordable #COVIDー19 vaccine.   We will continue to do our part to #flattenthecurve.   Tune in ⬇️: https://t.co/dkXCWcOHKM

Trump’s decision to strip the #CDC of their control over #COVID19 data is yet another example of why he is unfit to be president. We need a leader who is accountable and transparent not one who undermines our public institutions and safety.   https://t.co/pKCLIuFnCW
Join me for this critical virtual hearing  this afternoon about ICE’s response to #COVID19. https://t.co/r9aBddOSgh

A virus knows no bias.  But when decades of systemic racism force Black and Latino Americans into high-risk jobs limits their access to care and segregates them into poor environments it's inevitable that communities of color would be the hardest hit. #COVID19   H/t @nytimes https://t.co/5aEiD4MEnZ

My neighborhood— that’s central and south Brooklyn— is the epicenter of the #COVIDー19 pandemic. My constituents and I have experienced the firsthand devastation of this virus and it is crucial that we pass the #HeroesAct NOW. https://t.co/u3wJvnh9tA

I’m grateful for the the sacrifices our essential workers like my constituent and Jamaican sister Margaret have made to protect our community in the face of #coronavirus.   Thank you for all you do Margaret- your efforts do not go unnoticed nor unrecognized. #EverydayHeroes https://t.co/SN0KcC5Ywb

Communities of color including low-income #AAPI communities are disproportionately harmed by #COVID19. Don’t let our communities get left further behind. Help cut down these inequities by getting counted in the #2020Census. More info: https://t.co/Kt4XJrPP7i.

Important: You will not be asked about your #ImmigrationStatus when getting tested for #COVID19 at an @NYCHealthSystem location. These care services are not a public benefit under the #PublicCharge rule. https://t.co/kYAWiRp2HE

8M renters were struggling to pay rent before #COVID19. Congress should enact the housing provisions in #HEROESAct to create a uniform eviction moratorium protect people experiencing homelessness & provide #RentReliefNow.

I’ve been raising my voice for better health care for Black communities even before this pandemic and I am glad my efforts are helping bring 2 new #covid testing centers THIS WEEK to #NY09 (Flatbush & Crown Heights) as a part of @NYGovCuomo partnership w @ACPNY to expand access. https://t.co/buPStb7PG2

Join me as I provide insight in my role as @TheBlackCaucus Immigration Task Force Chair for this important convo about Black Immigrant Rights during #Covid.   Register (and receive access details)➡️ https://t.co/Xq9pFqYLFf https://t.co/XAUcbKKf8p

Glad to see results from my work to bring more COVID testing to central and south Brooklyn. Now families living in two @NYCHA locations in NY-09 (at Albany 1 & 2 and Nostrand/Sheepshead Bay) have access to free tests as part of @NYGovCuomo’s program in collab w/ Ready Responders.

I'm looking forward to my Small Business & Nonprofit Virtual Town Hall on Thursday w/ @RepJeffries @NydiaVelazquez @bradlander & @Bobby4Brooklyn to share resources with local nonprofits/small businesses impacted by #COVID19.  Submit questions by emailing teamclarke09@gmail.com. https://t.co/2ADQt0hZQv

My partnership with @FreshDirect means so much to me because we are working to ensure our community is well-fed and protected as coronavirus has devastated #NY09. #FlattenTheCurve #BrooklynStandUp  https://t.co/7ijVVH1C3c

I just voted for the #HEROESAct bc life is precious.   Brooklynites deserve the help this leg. will provide including:  👉🏾hazard pay for frontline workers  👉🏾billions of $ for testing to curb this virus  👉🏾support for families & small biz who are struggling bc of #COVID19

Our borough of Brooklyn’s #COVID-related death toll is more than the combined death toll of 46 states.   If you’ve been impacted by #coronavirus I have resources on my website: https://t.co/VEivi9Kj45…  Please do what you can to be safe #Brooklyn 🙏🏾 https://t.co/drqvFNHegg

Back in DC working hard #ForThePeople.   It’s crucial we pass the #HeroesAct—Brooklynites and all Americans deserve Congress’ action on both sides of the aisle because #COVID knows no political labels.   We have no time to waste. This is a matter of life and death. https://t.co/INDxJoxkIT

New Yorkers are resilient and we are working tirelessly to ensure our community #flattensthecurve and fully recovers from this pandemic.   Check out my @cspan interview on #COVID19's impact on central and south #Brooklyn one of the hardest-hit communities. #BrooklynStandup https://t.co/NdNGsH1aHI

To ensure protections for our Black and Brown brothers and sisters Senator @RonWyden and I led a letter to House and Senate leadership urging that any federal dollars used for artificial intelligence during coronavirus are vetted to protect against any algorithm bias. https://t.co/lApw99lchy

Just weeks ago @RepMaxineWaters passionately spoke on the House floor about her sister being sick with COVID-19.   My heart hurt for you then and it hurts even more today learning of your sister’s passing. My deepest condolences to you & your family. May Velma Rest In Peace 🙏🏾

It’s critical that we set our communities up for success in combating #COVID19 by providing access to sheltering for at-risk populations to properly distance & quarantine. It’s only fair to those who are putting their lives at risk to make sure they have a safe place to call home https://t.co/ShCoXhxxwa

Now more than ever journalists are critical in delivering essential information about #COVIDー19 and other news. I led a letter to House Leadership so the important work of the digital press can continue to deliver high-quality journalism to Americans during this pandemic. https://t.co/eK2IYAceEi
👉🏾TUNE IN: Will be on @cspan Washington Journal just after the top of the hour to talk about #COVID19’s impact on #Brooklyn

I led a letter with @RepEliotEngel and our colleagues to @HHSGov Secretary Azar advocating for dedicated funding for federally qualified community health centers (FQHCs) in regions hit hardest by #COVID19. We must do all we can to protect our most vulnerable communities. 🙏🏾 https://t.co/oWV2wRtF46
Join me and @RepSusanWild tonight for this important conversation on #racial health disparities within #COVID19 .  Register here: https://t.co/IWEQmHAwqA https://t.co/0tjItGgyqh

I'm proud to join my NYC Congressional Delegation colleagues @RepAOC and @RepGraceMeng in pushing for the next #COVID19 relief package to include rent and mortgage forgiveness.  It is crucial that New Yorkers and ALL Americans are financially prepared to combat this pandemic. https://t.co/L0TkKwdpwh

Nearly half of Americans report that #coronavirus has had a negative impact on their mental health. Know that you are not alone. Learn the warning signs so you can get help for yourself or somebody you know. #MentalHealthMonth

During this vulnerable time we need to do all we can to protect one another from fraud and scams. Join me & special guests FTC Commissioner @chopraftc and NY Attorney General @TishJames for a tele town hall on Protecting Consumers & Small Businesses in the face of #coronavirus. https://t.co/ACSABumURA

We must protect the American people from these deceptive tactics especially as our great nation battles this pandemic. I am pleased that my bill the “Ending One-Ring Scams Act” is now a part of the solution at the @FCC to safeguard consumers from #covid19 con artists. https://t.co/65DICWaO7s

The #CARESAct provides relief during #Coronavirus pandemic. Get more information on the @USTreasury website about assistance for:   ✅ small businesses including the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP)  ✅ workers & families  ✅ industry job preservation    https://t.co/BRjrj5h9yF

Join the @CBWGCAUCUS co-chairs for a virtual Sunday brunch with @HigherHeights on the State of Black Women and Girls in the face of the #coronavirus pandemic. In this time of renewal it’s crucial that we mobilize to protect girls like us.  🔗: https://t.co/Crz8XQsB2f https://t.co/vpIvTIPDzA

Happy Sunday! Today I’m grateful that @BPEricAdams & I were able to deliver PPE to #CrownHeights residents. Special thanks to @ReadyRes for partnering with us to ensure #NY09 is equipped to combat #COVID19.   With 28183 positive cases in BK this work can’t and won’t stop. https://t.co/FwDIWDnuoF

I’m back in D.C. to ensure we do right by the millions of Americans impacted by #coronavirus.  I cannot stand idly by as the good people of #NY09 are fighting the battle of their lives while Republican governors reopen country clubs for their wealthy friends like Donald Trump. https://t.co/TKtibBzIBn

As we celebrate the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay I joined @RepBobbyRush in calling on @EPA to strengthen clean air protections. Air pollution not only contributes to the climate crisis it is also linked to the lethality of COVID-19 within our most vulnerable communities. https://t.co/a21XWKrRJ7

Nearly 1.7M immigrants are health care workers and millions more are essential workers risking their lives everyday to save others.   Proud to join @maziehirono to ensure that everyone can access critical coronavirus relief benefits & health services. #DiversityIsOurStrength https://t.co/kRr4hp8skI

Trump is yet again using immigrants as his pawns instead of doing actual presidential work. Surprised? Nah. Disappointed? Definitely.   People are dying and 45 won’t take any responsibility nor action to protect lives. ENOUGH. #coronavirus https://t.co/yQciFzOgpo

I’m so grateful that #NY09 & ⁦@NewsatMedgar⁩ are the home of Brooklyn’s newest #COVID19 testing center for frontline workers healthcare employees & seniors.  It’s crucial that we prioritize the care of the most vulnerable members of our community. https://t.co/qTc1BqmixI

This year #BlackMaternalHealthWeek comes in the midst of a pandemic. The racial disparities in #COVID19 outcomes reflect ongoing disparities in maternal mortality rates in the US. As a Member of the @BMHCaucus I am working hard to address this crisis. #BMHW20

Social distancing helps to slow the spread of coronavirus. Now more than ever we must make this sacrifice to protect our community. https://t.co/rIHxRtZPiP

True to form Donald Trump says one thing and does another. I’m co-sponsoring the Medical Supply Chain Emergency Act to force the President to follow through with the #DefenseProductionActNOW. Our #COVID19 frontline responders can’t go any longer without the supplies they need.

I wouldn't have supported the CARES Act if there was a Democratic President & Senate but I must act now to protect my constituents.
